repnme.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outocme is assessed as
            satisfactory, while sustainability is likely. Bank
            performance is rated satisfactory. Borrower performance
            overall is considered satisfactory in the implementation of
            the program, especially with respect to perseverance in
            carrying out the program once economic conditions
            deteriorated and in the face of domestic opposition. A
            stable social and political environment is essential to
            support macroeconomic and structural reforms. The government
            made good progress during the early phase of the project,
            but increasingly, in the face of domestic opposition,
            political instability, civil unrest and a mutiny, program
            implementation became more arduous during 2001. Other
            lessons learned include these: Careful investment in
            preparation to ensure strong ownership and build counterpart
            commitment and understanding are important to maintain
            reform momentum. It was worth taking the risk of involvement
            in a new adjustment program once the new government had
            established its reformist credentials, notwithstanding the
            poor track record of reforms of previous governments. When
            counterpart capacity is not strong, close and frequent
            supervision by the Bank is neded to achieve program
            completion. The burden of program implementation would have
            been considerably eased and made smoother if a more formal
            and extensive mechanism had been established in government
            with responsibility for program implementation.

Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion

1969789.trustfund:
TF040692-PAPUA NEW GUINEA: GOVERNANCE
            PROMOTION ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF039787-PAPUA NEW GUINEA - STRUCTURAL
            REFORM IN PNG,TF039747-PAPUA NEW GUINEA -  SAL III -
            STRUCTURAL REFORM

repnme.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion
            Adjustment Loan : Panel Report and Recommendation and
            Management's Response to the Inspection Panel

abstracts.cdata!:
The Governance Promotion Adjustment Loan
            (GPAL) for Papua New Guinea is examined in the Inspection
            Panel Report and Recommendation and Request for Inspection.
            The GPAL made to Papua New Guinea is US$90 million, released
            over 3 years with the intention of aiding the stabilization
            and structural reform efforts of the government. The
            Request, submitted by the Center of Environmental Law and
            Community Rights, Inc (CELCOR) claims that the Management
            plans to release the last amount of the loan money despite
            the fact that the Government has not complied with
            disbursement conditions related to forestry management. The
            Panel finds that the Bank's actions were in compliance
            with the policies and procedures set forth and that adverse
            effects suffered by the Requesters were in no way related to
            the GPAL.

3054249.trustfund:
TF039747-PAPUA NEW GUINEA -  SAL III -
            STRUCTURAL REFORM,TF039787-PAPUA NEW GUINEA - STRUCTURAL
            REFORM IN PNG,TF040692-PAPUA NEW GUINEA: GOVERNANCE
            PROMOTION ADJUSTMENT LOAN

repnme.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion
            Adjustment Loan : Eligibility Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Eligibility Report for the
            Governance Promotion Adjustment Loan (GPAL) for Papua New
            Guinea outlines the request for inspection details. The
            Requesters claim that Management, in violation of the terms
            and conditions under which the Board of Executive Directors
            approved the GPAL, intends to release its last tranche,
            despite the fact that the Borrower, i.e. the Government, has
            not complied with disbursement conditions related to
            forestry management. In Management's opinion, the
            Bank's actions related to the GPAL were in compliance
            with the relevant policies and procedures. To determine the
            eligibility of the Request and the Requesters, the Panel
            reviewed the Request and Management's Response. In the
            Panel's view, the evident harm suffered by the
            Requesters is not related to an act or omission of the Bank
            and the Panel does not recommend an investigation into the
            matter alleged in the Request.

3033282.trustfund:
TF039747-PAPUA NEW GUINEA -  SAL III -
            STRUCTURAL REFORM,TF039787-PAPUA NEW GUINEA - STRUCTURAL
            REFORM IN PNG,TF040692-PAPUA NEW GUINEA: GOVERNANCE
            PROMOTION ADJUSTMENT LOAN

repnme.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion
            Adjustment Loan : Request for Inspection

abstracts.cdata!:
This request for inspection comes from
            landowners who seek the assistance of the Inspection Panel
            because they have lost their land and forests during the
            currency of the Governance Promotion Adjustment Loan by the
            World Bank to Papua New Guinea.  The Requesters claim that
            the Papua New Guinea government and logging industry
            participants failed to fulfill or demonstrate good faith on
            conditionalitys aimed at improving forest governance,
            imposed by the Bank on the Structural Adjustment Programme
            Loan (SAL.) The Requesters claim that the submission deals
            with significant instances of social, cultural, ecological
            and economic harm and that the disbursement of the second
            tranche without requiring a full review of the contractual
            provisions of the loan constitutes a violation of the
            contractual provisions of the SAL by loaning to a borrower
            defaults to implement its own promises.  Examples set out in
            the claim indicating the development objectives of the
            governance loan have not been met and are unlikely to be
            met, if the disbursement of the second tranche is completed.
            The Requesters ask the Inspection Panel to address the need
            that arises from this claim. The Requesters ask that there
            be a moratorium on new concessions in the forests of Papua
            New Guinea to allow a respite for reform, that landowners be
            compensated for their losses, and the institutional reform
            processes put in place firmly.

Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion
            Adjustment Loan : Request for Inspection

5086510.trustfund:
TF040692-PAPUA NEW GUINEA: GOVERNANCE
            PROMOTION ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF026104-PHRD-ECONOMIC AND FINANCIAL

5086510.majtheme: Public sector governance,Environment and natural resource management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Governance Promotion Adjustment Loan
            Project for Papua New Guinea supports the government's
            ongoing efforts to redress past policy and governance
            shortcomings in a sustainable manner. Hence the loan
            includes components to improve fiscal and debt management,
            governance and civil service effectiveness, delivery of
            health and education services, forestry management, the
            quality and efficiency of financial services including those
            available through privatization, and the operating
            environment for business. A pervading theme is to strengthen
            governance in public institutions through enhanced
            transparency and accountability. Other benefits expected
            include improved public sector management capacity to
            provide core government services, a reduced public sector
            role in commercial activities, an improved climate for
            private sector development, and improved management of
            natural resources. The risks to attaining the loan's
            objectives stem for a number of factors: political
            opposition could compromise reform; weaknesses in
            implementation capacity could constrain reform
            sustainability; the government's vulnerability to
            commodity price fluctuations and natural disasters could
            undermine gains from improved policy; and high crime rates
            could weaken the supply response from ongoing reforms. In
            accordance with noted conditions, the loan will be disbursed
            in two tranches.

docna.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Governance Promotion
            Adjustment Loan Project

display_title.display_title:
Papua New Guinea - Governance
            Promotion Adjustment Loan Project
